Danbury.Highstead Foundation:
Highstead, formerly known as Highstead Arboretum, in Redding, Connecticut, United States was founded in 1982. It covers 36 acres (146,000 m²) of woodland, meadow, and wetland and ranges from 640 feet (200 m) to 758 feet (231 m) in elevation and hosts both native and cultivated plant varieties.
Highstead includes the following collections:
The Native tree and shrub collection, with indigenous plants from within a 100-mile (160 km) radius of the arboretum.
